intro: Meibomia barbata, commonly known as the hairy meibomia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and are clustered in small inflorescences. Meibomia barbata is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
